paintbrush.bristles: - Bristles - The soft, flexible fibers at one end of the paintbrush used to apply and transfer paint to surfaces.
paintbrush.head: - Head - The part of the paintbrush where the bristles are secured, facilitating the application of paint.
paintbrush.tip: - Tip - The very end of the brush's bristles, typically pointed, used for precise and detailed application of paint or ink.

hairbrush.bristles: - Bristles - Small, stiff fibers on one surface of the brush used to detangle and style hair.
hairbrush.pad: - Pad - The cushioned base where the bristles are anchored, which flexes slightly to contour to the scalp during brushing.
hairbrush.back: - Back - The flat, opposite side of the bristle area, which can be used to pound against surfaces.
hairbrush.head: - Head - The part of the brush where the bristles are attached, used to sweep along surfaces.

toothbrush.bristles: - Bristles - Small, stiff fibers typically made of nylon at the toothbrush head, used for cleaning teeth.
toothbrush.head: - Head - The top, typically rectangular part of the toothbrush where the bristles are attached, used for brushing teeth.

mop.bristles: - Bristles - Stiff fibers at the end of the mop used to sweep and brush away dirt.
mop.head: - Head - The part of the mop to which bristles are attached, used for cleaning floors and surfaces.

broom.bristles: - Bristles - Stiff, hair-like fibers at the bottom of the broom used for sweeping.
broom.head: - Head - The lower end of the broom where bristles are attached for sweeping.

brush.bristles: - Bristles - The dense assembly of flexible fibers or strands at one end of the brush, used for sweeping or mixing substances.
brush.head: - Head - The part of the brush where the bristles are attached, typically flat or slightly curved, used for brushing actions.

feather.barb: - Barb - Small, fine projections extending from the central shaft of a feather, interlocking to form the vane and capable of trapping dust particles.
feather.vane: - Vane - The flat, extended surface on either side of a feather's shaft, consisting of numerous barbs used for sweeping or brushing particles.

dagger.blade: - Blade - The flat, sharp part used for cutting, scraping, and peeling.
dagger.edge: - Edge - The sharpened side of the blade used for slicing or scraping materials.
dagger.tip: - Tip - The pointed end of the dagger blade, useful for inserting into small openings to pry.
dagger.spine: - Spine - The non-sharpened back edge of the dagger blade that provides rigid support for prying.

letter opener.blade: - Blade - The flat, sharp, typically metal part used for cutting or scraping.
letter opener.edge: - Edge - The sharpened side of the blade used for slicing through envelopes or scraping off materials.
letter opener.tip: - Tip - The pointed and sharp end of the letter opener, used for poking or stirring small contents.

chisel.blade: - Blade - The flat, sharp part of the chisel used for cutting, carving, scraping, slicing, or wedging into various materials.
chisel.edge: - Edge - The sharpened side of the blade used for cutting, slicing, or scraping material.
chisel.tip: - Tip - The sharp, pointed end of the chisel blade used for piercing, puncturing, and initiating cuts into materials.

cleaver.blade: - Blade - The broad, flat part of the cleaver used for chopping, cutting, and scraping surfaces.
cleaver.edge: - Edge - The sharpened side of the blade used for slicing, lifting items, and scraping surfaces.
cleaver.back: - Back - The thick, blunt top edge of the cleaver blade, opposite the cutting edge, used for spreading substances.
cleaver.side: - Side - The broad, flat surfaces of the cleaver blade, usable for pounding and spreading soft materials.

axe.blade: - Blade - The sharp, wedge-shaped metal part used for cutting or splitting.
axe.edge: - Edge - The sharpened boundary of the blade used for cutting or splitting materials.
axe.back: - Back - The flat, opposite side of the axe blade, often used for hammering.
axe.head: - Head - The top part of an axe, which includes both the blade and the back.

razor blade.blade: - Blade - The thin, flat metal piece that is sharp and used for cutting.
razor blade.edge: - Edge - The sharpened side of the razor blade used for slicing or scraping materials.
razor blade.corner: - Corner - The point where two edges of the razor blade meet, often used for more precise scraping.

box cutter.blade: - Blade - The sharp, retractable metal part used for cutting, slicing, or scraping materials.
box cutter.edge: - Edge - The sharpened side of the blade used for cutting, scraping, or peeling materials.
box cutter.tip: - Tip - The pointed end of the blade that initiates piercing.

machete.blade: - Blade - The long, wide, flat part used for cutting and scraping.
machete.edge: - Edge - The sharpened side of the blade used for slicing or scraping materials.
machete.tip: - Tip - The pointed end of the blade, suitable for piercing.

saw.blade: - Blade - The toothed metal strip which slices through materials.
saw.teeth: - Teeth - The jagged edges along the blade used for cutting.

credit card.edge: - Edge - The thin, straight perimeter of the credit card, often used for sweeping small items.
credit card.surface: - Surface - The flat, broad side of the credit card.
credit card.corner: - Corner - One of the pointy edges of the credit card, typically more effective for scraping.

scalpel.blade: - Blade - The thin, flat, sharp metal part used for cutting, scraping, peeling, or mixing.
scalpel.edge: - Edge - The sharpened side of the blade used for slicing, incisions, or separating materials.
scalpel.tip: - Tip - The very end of the blade that is sharp and pointed, ideal for piercing.
scalpel.shaft: - Shaft - The elongated part connecting the handle to the blade, can also be used for mixing.

spatula.edge: - Edge - The thin, slightly sharpened side of the spatula blade designed for slicing or lifting.
spatula.blade: - Blade - The flat, wide, and flexible part of the spatula used for lifting, flipping, and spreading.
spatula.head: - Head - The broad upper section attached to the handle, designed for lifting and distributing substances or food items.
spatula.tip: - Tip - The end portion of the blade, which can be inserted to pry.

ice skate.blade: - Blade - The metal part attached beneath the boot that comes into contact with the ice, used for cutting into the ice surface.
ice skate.edge: - Edge - The sharp side of the blade that slices into the ice during skating movements.

knife.blade: - Blade - The flat, sharp part of the knife used for cutting, digging, and prying.
knife.edge: - Edge - The sharpened side of the blade used for slicing, scraping, or spreading materials.
knife.tip: - Tip - The pointed end of the knife blade, designed for piercing or prying into narrow spaces.
knife.spine: - Spine - The top, non-sharpened edge of the blade that provides strength and support for lifting or prying.
knife.back: - Back - The dull opposite edge of the blade that can be safer to use for mixing without cutting.

pizza cutter.blade: - Blade - The round, sharp part that rotates to slice through pizza.
pizza cutter.edge: - Edge - The outer circumference of the blade that makes contact with the pizza to cut it.

scissors.edges: - Edges - The sharpened sides of the blades that slice through items.
scissors.blade: - Blade - The flat, sharp part used for cutting, which can also be used to scrape surfaces.
scissors.point: - Point - The sharp tip of each blade used for piercing materials.

key.edge: - Edge - The side of the key blade that can be thin and sharp enough for cutting.
key.blade: - Blade - The long, flat part of the key that contains cuts and grooves, designed for insertion into a lock.
key.tip: - Tip - The pointed end of the key opposite the head, used for insertion, prying, or scraping in small openings.

CD.edge: - Edge - The thin, circular outer boundary of the CD that may be sharp enough to scrape or lightly cut surfaces.

ruler.edge: - Edge - The straight, thin side of the ruler used for cutting, lifting, scraping, spreading materials, and prying.
ruler.end: - End - The flat, shorter side of the ruler used for prying, levering, or manipulating objects.
ruler.corner: - Corner - The point where two edges meet, often used for more precise scraping tasks.
ruler.surface: - Surface - The flat, broad face of the ruler, suitable for spreading substances evenly.

sword.blade: - Blade - the long, flat part used for slicing or cutting.
sword.edge: - Edge - the sharpened side of the blade designed to make incisions.
sword.point: - Point - The sharp tip of the sword designed for piercing.

fork.tines: - Tines - Long, thin, pointed projections at the end of the fork used for piercing, picking up, and manipulating food.
fork.tip: - Tip - The pointed ends of the tines used for piercing and poking into food items.
fork.edge: - Edge - The side of the tines that can be used to scrape against surfaces.
fork.neck: - Neck - The section that connects the handle to the head of the fork, which can be swirled around in a mixing action.
fork.shaft: - Shaft - The long, narrow part of each tine which can help leverage in prying actions.

shovel.blade: - Blade - The flat, broad part at the end of the shovel used for digging, scooping, scraping, and prying materials.
shovel.tip: - Tip - The pointed end of the blade designed for breaking hard ground and prying into narrow spaces.
shovel.scoop: - Scoop - The concave, curved part of the blade that holds and lifts materials like soil or snow.
shovel.edge: - Edge - The bottom edge of the shovel blade that comes into contact with the ground or other surfaces.
shovel.back: - Back - The flat, opposite side of the shovel's blade, used for pounding.

spoon.bowl: - Bowl - The rounded, concave part at the end of the spoon used for scooping, holding, or spreading substances.
spoon.tip: - Tip - The end of the spoon's bowl farthest from the handle, used for scooping, lifting food, and prying into narrow spaces.
spoon.back: - Back - The convex, outward-facing side of the spoon's bowl, used for pressing, pounding, spreading, or mixing.
spoon.rim: - Rim - The edge or perimeter of the spoon's bowl that assists in scooping and scraping items.

pickaxe.head: - Head - The metal end of the pickaxe, heavy and designed for digging into and breaking materials.
pickaxe.blade: - Blade - The flat, wide, and sharp side of the pickaxe head used for cutting, scooping, breaking up materials, and scraping surfaces.
pickaxe.tip: - Tip - The very end of the point, which is the initial part to make contact when poking.
pickaxe.back: - Back - The rear part of the head opposite the pointed end, often used for hammering.
pickaxe.adze: - Adze - The horizontal blade on the opposite side of the point, used for scooping or carving.

trowel.blade: - Blade - The flat, typically metal and pointed part used for digging, scooping, and scraping soil.
trowel.tip: - Tip - The sharp end of the blade used for penetrating the ground and precision spreading.
trowel.scoop: - Scoop - The concave, curved section of the blade designed to lift and hold materials.
trowel.edge: - Edge - The sharpened or straight boundary of the blade used for scraping, pushing, or gathering material.

plow.blade: - Blade - The flat, sharp part used for breaking and turning the soil.
plow.share: - Share - The cutting edge at the bottom of the plow which slices into the ground.
plow.moldboard: - Moldboard - The curved surface that lifts and rolls the soil sideways.

chopsticks.tip: - Tip - The narrow, tapered end of the chopstick used for picking up, piercing, or manipulating food items.
chopsticks.shaft: - Shaft - The long, slender body of the chopstick, effective for stirring and mixing in deeper vessels.

screwdriver.shaft: - Shaft - The long, cylindrical metal part extending from the handle to the tip, used for scraping or prying.
screwdriver.tip: - Tip - The pointed or flat end of the screwdriver, used for inserting into screw heads, small crevices, or for prying objects apart.

hoe.blade: - Blade - The flat, sharp metal part at the end of the hoe used for breaking up soil, chopping, weeding, or scraping material across surfaces.
hoe.face: - Face - The broad, flat surface of the blade used for pushing or pulling through soil and debris.
hoe.edge: - Edge - The sharpened side of the blade that digs into and scrapes soil or debris.

stick.tip: - Tip - The narrow, pointy end of the stick used for piercing or poking into materials.

awl.tip: - Tip - The sharp, pointed end of the awl used for piercing, scraping, or mixing materials.
awl.shaft: - Shaft - The long, typically metal part of the awl extending from the handle to the tip, used for applying pressure and capable of rotation.
awl.blade: - Blade - The sharp, thin metal part used for scraping.
awl.spike: - Spike - The long, tapered metal part that includes the tip and is used for poking or making holes.

nail.tip: - Tip - The very end of the nail designed for initial penetration and contact with surfaces.
nail.shank: - Shank - The long, straight body of the nail which can also be used to scrape.

paddle.blade: - Blade - The broad, flat part of the paddle used for pushing against water, soil, sand, or for stirring contents.
paddle.tip: - Tip - The end part of the blade that can be used to pierce or break into the ground.
paddle.face: - Face - The wide, flat surface on either side of the blade, used for exerting pressure, sweeping movements, and mixing materials.
paddle.edge: - Edge - The side part of the blade useful for scraping along narrow lines or tighter spots.

dustpan.scoop: - Scoop - The main concave part of the dustpan used to collect and hold debris.
dustpan.lip: - Lip - The flat, slightly raised edge that contacts the floor to facilitate sweeping debris into the dustpan.
dustpan.pan: - Pan - The flat, typically broad receptacle part that collects dust and debris.

lid.underside: - Underside - The lower surface of the lid that faces into the container, which can also press against contents or another surface when flipped.
lid.top: - Top - The uppermost surface of the lid, which can be used to apply a lifting force.
lid.edge: - Edge - The thin, outer rim of the lid that can be used to scrape substances.

teapot.base: - Base - The bottom surface of the teapot, which can be pressed against a surface.
teapot.spout: - Spout - The protruding part of the teapot designed to direct and control the pouring of liquids.

pan.base: - Base - The flat bottom surface of the pan that comes into contact with heat sources for cooking.
pan.bowl: - Bowl - The curved interior part of the pan where food or liquids accumulate, useful for scooping.
pan.rim: - Rim - The circular edge around the top of the pan that assists in controlling and scooping out liquids.
pan.spout: - Spout - A specifically designed protrusion or notch at the rim of the pan to direct the flow of liquids.
pan.side: - Side - The vertical perimeter of the pan that can also be utilized to pound.

plate.base: - Base - The bottom surface of the plate, which can be pressed against a surface.
plate.rim: - Rim - The perimeter or edge of the plate that supports lifting.
plate.surface: - Surface - The flat, usually circular area of the plate, useful for sliding underneath to lift.

plank.surface: - Surface - The flat, broad side of the plank which can be pressed against other objects.

smartphone.back: - Back - The rear exterior surface of the smartphone.

bottle.base: - Base - The bottom part of the bottle, typically flat and stable, used to press against surfaces.
bottle.mouth: - Mouth - The opening at the very top of the bottle from which liquids can be poured out.
bottle.neck: - Neck - The narrow part at the top of the bottle which tapers from the body leading to the opening.
bottle.body: - Body - The cylindrical central part of the bottle, robust and capable of rolling on its side.
bottle.side: - Side - The curved surface of the bottle that makes contact with another surface when pounded or rolled.

jar.base: - Base - The bottom part of the jar, typically flat, which can be pressed against a surface.
jar.mouth: - Mouth - The opening at the top of the jar from which contents are poured out.
jar.neck: - Neck - The upper part of the jar that tapers towards the mouth, guiding the flow of contents.
jar.body: - Body - The main cylindrical or rounded part of the jar, robust enough for handling and rolling.

cup.base: - Base - The bottom part of the cup, which can be pressed against a surface.
cup.bowl: - Bowl - The open, hollow part of the cup used to contain liquids or solids.
cup.rim: - Rim - The upper edge of the cup where it opens outward for pouring liquid.
cup.lip: - Lip - The slightly protruded edge at the top of the cup aimed at directing the flow of liquid.
cup.side: - Side - The cylindrical outer surface of the cup that can make rolling contact with a surface.

pestle.head: - Head - The broad, rounded end of the pestle used for pressing, crushing, or grinding substances.
pestle.body: - Body - The main cylindrical part of the pestle, which can also be used for pounding ingredients.

hammer.head: - Head - The solid, heavy metal part at the top of the hammer, used for striking.
hammer.face: - Face - The flat, front part of the hammer's head used for making contact with and pounding nails or other objects.
hammer.claw: - Claw - The curved, forked part typically at the back of a hammer head, used for pulling nails.

pot.base: - Base - The flat, bottom surface of the pot used for stability and crushing ingredients.
pot.rim: - Rim - The upper edge of the pot that facilitates direction control when pouring contents.
pot.spout: - Spout - The protruding part designed to direct the flow of liquid being poured.
pot.side: - Side - The curved surfaces forming the exterior of the pot, which can be used to pound against surfaces.

CD case.cover: - Cover - The flat, rigid outer surface of the CD case.
CD case.back: - Back - The flat, rigid reverse side of the CD case.

ladle.bowl: - Bowl - The deep, rounded part of the ladle designed to scoop, hold, and pour liquids.
ladle.rim: - Rim - The outer edge of the ladle's bowl used for scooping and pouring liquids.
ladle.side: - Side - The curved outer surface of the bowl, which can make contact when pounding.

shoe.sole: - Sole - The bottom part of the shoe, typically made of hard material, that contacts and interacts with the ground.
shoe.heel: - Heel - The rear part of the shoe's sole, thicker to elevate and support the back of the foot.
shoe.opening: - Opening - The area where the foot enters the shoe, potentially channeling small items.

glass.base: - Base - The bottom part of the glass, typically flat and stable, used for pressing against surfaces.
glass.rim: - Rim - The upper circular edge of the glass where liquid exits during pouring.
glass.bowl: - Bowl - The hollow, curved part of the glass where substances can be scooped.
glass.lip: - Lip - The slightly protruding part of the rim that directs the flow of liquid.
glass.body: - Body - The cylindrical or curved part of the glass that allows it to roll when placed on its side.

stone.surface: - Surface - The flat, outer part of the stone which can be pressed against other objects.

clipboard.base: - Base - The flat, main surface of the clipboard that supports and holds papers.
clipboard.backboard: - Backboard - The rigid board that supports the paper and provides a firm surface for pressing.

book.cover: - Cover - The hard or soft outer surface of the book that can be pressed against other objects.

brick.face: - Face - The large, flat side of a brick used for structure and impact.
brick.side: - Side - One of the smaller and narrow flat surfaces of the brick.

tablet.back: - Back - The rear flat surface that could be pressed against other surfaces.

bowl.base: - Base - The flat, stable bottom part of the bowl that rests against surfaces and can be used for pounding.
bowl.interior: - Interior - The inner surface of the bowl where items are placed and can be scooped up.
bowl.rim: - Rim - The upper edge of the bowl that aids in scooping and directing liquids.
bowl.side: - Side - The curved surface of the bowl that can be used for pounding.

meat tenderizer.base: - Base - The bottom part of the tenderizer head, typically flat and used to press down on meat.
meat tenderizer.face: - Face - The flat or textured surface on one side of the tenderizer head that comes into direct contact with the meat.
meat tenderizer.head: - Head - The heavy, solid part usually made of metal used to pound meat.

can.base: - Base - The bottom surface of the can, which can be pressed against a surface.
can.mouth: - Mouth - The opening at the top of the can from which contents can be poured out.
can.rim: - Rim - The edge surrounding the mouth that helps direct the flow of liquid.
can.body: - Body - The cylindrical main part of the can, typically made of metal, that touches surfaces and rolls.
can.side: - Side - The curved external surface of the can that makes contact with the ground when rolled.

cutting board.base: - Base - The bottom side of the cutting board that can be pressed against a surface.
cutting board.surface: - Surface - The flat, top area of the cutting board used for placing items to be lifted.

mallet.head: - Head - The heavy, typically cylindrical or block-like top part of the mallet used for striking.
mallet.face: - Face - The flat or slightly rounded, typically circular part at each end of the head that contacts surfaces during use.

stamp.base: - Base - The bottom part of the stamp that makes contact with the ink and paper.
stamp.face: - Face - The flat surface on the base where the inked design or letters are engraved.

mug.base: - Base - The bottom surface of the mug, which can be pressed against a surface.
mug.rim: - Rim - The upper circular edge of the mug from which contents are sipped or poured.
mug.body: - Body - The main, typically cylindrical part of the mug that comes into contact with surfaces when rolling
mug.handle: - Handle - The curved or looped part protruding from the side of the mug, designed for hanging onto hooks or pegs.

tray.base: - Base - The flat bottom part of the tray used for pressing against surfaces.
tray.surface: - Surface - The top flat area where items are placed, which is used to lift items.

water bottle.base: - Base - The bottom surface of the water bottle, which can be pressed against a surface.
water bottle.mouth: - Mouth - The opening at the top of the water bottle from which liquids are poured out.
water bottle.neck: - Neck - The narrow part that connects the body of the bottle to the mouth, guiding the flow of liquid.
water bottle.body: - Body - The main cylindrical part of the bottle, capable of rolling on its side and usable for pounding objects.
water bottle.side: - Side - The curved surface of the bottle that can make contact with a surface when rolled.

candle holder.base: - Base - The flat, sturdy bottom part of the candle holder that supports it on a surface.
candle holder.plate: - Plate - The flat, usually circular area where the candle sits, which could also be pressed down.
candle holder.body: - Body - The main structural part of the candle holder, which can be used for pounding if it is solid and heavy.

jug.base: - Base - The bottom surface of the jug, which can be pressed against a surface.
jug.rim: - Rim - The top edge of the jug, useful for pouring liquids and scooping larger quantities when tipped.
jug.spout: - Spout - The protruding part at the top designed to direct the flow of liquid.

saucepan.base: - Base - The flat bottom part of the saucepan that comes into contact with the heat source.
saucepan.body: - Body - The main, usually rounded or slightly tapered part of the saucepan that holds contents.
saucepan.rim: - Rim - The upper edge of the saucepan designed for pouring or scooping out contents.
saucepan.spout: - Spout - A specially designed lip or notch on the rim that facilitates pouring liquids smoothly.
saucepan.side: - Side - The vertical walls of the saucepan that could be used for pounding.

boot.sole: - Sole - The bottom part of the boot, usually made of rubber or leather, designed for durability and ground contact.
boot.heel: - Heel - The rear part of the sole that is elevated and thicker to provide support and durability.

coffee pot.base: - Base - The bottom part of the coffee pot that can be pressed against a surface.
coffee pot.spout: - Spout - The narrow, protruding part at the top used to direct the flow of coffee.
coffee pot.mouth: - Mouth - The opening at the top of the coffee pot where coffee is poured out.

bucket.base: - Base - The bottom surface of the bucket, which can be pressed against a surface.
bucket.rim: - Rim - The upper edge of the bucket that assists in leveling or scraping materials and directs the flow of liquid when pouring.

flask.base: - Base - The flat bottom part of the flask that can be pressed against a surface.
flask.mouth: - Mouth - The opening at the top of the flask for pouring or scooping out liquids.
flask.neck: - Neck - The narrow top part of the flask that leads to the mouth, guiding liquids or materials as they are poured or added.

kettle.base: - Base - The bottom part of the kettle that can be pressed against a surface.
kettle.spout: - Spout - The elongated, usually curved projection from which hot liquids are poured out.
kettle.mouth: - Mouth - The opening at the end of the spout where the liquid exits.

seashell.lip: - Lip - The curved rim of the seashell's opening, aiding in lifting and scooping.
seashell.apex: - Apex - The tip or highest point of the shell which can be hooked or grasped to lift.
seashell.bowl: - Bowl - The concave part of the seashell that can hold small amounts of liquid or sand.

pitchfork.tines: - Tines - Long, pointed prongs at the end of a pitchfork used for penetrating, scraping, or gathering materials.
pitchfork.tips: - Tips - The end points of the tines that can be used to scratch or scrape surfaces.
pitchfork.head: - Head - The part of the pitchfork where the tines are attached, aiding in sweeping movements.

pen.tip: - Tip - The narrow, pointed end of the pen, typically made of metal or hard plastic, used for writing and delivering ink to the surface.
pen.barrel: - Barrel - The main cylindrical body of the pen that facilitates rolling and can be used to stir or mix contents.
pen.ball: - Ball - The small, spherical component in a ballpoint pen that dispenses ink as it rolls across a surface.

squeegee.blade: - Blade - The flat, flexible part that directly contacts surfaces to wipe or scrape liquid.
squeegee.rubber: - Rubber - The flexible, resilient strip on the blade's edge that contacts and wipes surfaces clean.

pin.shaft: - Shaft - The elongated metal part of the pin that can assist in scraping.
pin.tip: - Tip - The very end of the point that first makes contact when piercing or poking.

grater.blades: - Blades - The sharp-edged slots or rows that shred or slice food items.
grater.surface: - Surface - The flat area embedded with numerous cutting blades for grating.

paper clip.loop: - Loop - The curved, continuous sections of the paper clip, each forming a loop-like shape, capable of hooking onto objects.
paper clip.end: - End - The tips of the paper clip that can be manipulated to hook and hang onto surfaces.

comb.teeth: - Teeth - The series of narrow, pointed elements spaced along the comb's edge used to pass through hair or other materials.
comb.edge: - Edge - The side or rim of the comb which can be used to scrape surfaces.

stylus.tip: - Tip - The narrow, pointed end of the stylus used for precise contact with touchscreens and other surfaces.
stylus.shaft: - Shaft - The long, straight portion that connects the tip to the rest of the stylus.

license plate.edge: - Edge - The thin, rigid perimeter of the license plate that could scrape surfaces.

pencil.tip: - Tip - The sharpened, pointed end of the pencil where graphite is exposed for writing and making contact with surfaces.
pencil.graphite: - Graphite - The core material inside the pencil used to make marks on paper.
pencil.barrel: - Barrel - The long, cylindrical main body of the pencil that could be used to stir or mix substances.

toothpick.tip: - Tip - The pointed end of the toothpick used for penetrating and scraping small areas.
toothpick.shaft: - Shaft - The slender main body of the toothpick which can be used for scraping surfaces.

hook.curve: - Curve - The rounded, bent part of the hook used to catch, support, or pull objects.
hook.barb: - Barb - A backward-facing projection near the point that is designed to lodge in the material being pierced.
hook.tip: - Tip - The pointy end of the hook that can enter an object or hang onto small loops.

coin.edge: - Edge - The thin, outer rim of the coin used for scraping surfaces.

rake.tines: - Tines - Pointed, spaced projections on the rake's head used to contact and collect leaves, debris, or soil from the ground.
rake.head: - Head - The horizontal, flat section where tines are attached, used to drag or gather materials.

file.teeth: - Teeth - The rough, serrated surface designed for filing or scraping materials.
file.edge: - Edge - The side or rim of the file that can be used to scrape in narrow spaces.

peeler.blade: - Blade - The sharp, flat component that shaves off the outer layers of fruits or vegetables.
peeler.edge: - Edge - The sharpened side of the blade that scrapes off surfaces or removes food skin.

corkscrew.spiral: - Spiral - The coiled metal part that penetrates the cork, which can also scrape off materials.
corkscrew.tip: - Tip - The pointed end of the spiral used to initiate piercing and scrape small areas of the cork.
corkscrew.lever: - Lever - The arm that applies pressure to lift the cork out of the bottle.
corkscrew.fork: - Fork - Sometimes found as a two-pronged end used to pry and remove seals or other items.

needle.point: - Point - The sharp tip of the needle used for piercing through materials and scraping small areas.
needle.shaft: - Shaft - The elongated body of the needle which can be used to scrape along surfaces.

hockey stick.blade: - Blade - The flat, curved end of the hockey stick used to contact and manipulate the puck.
hockey stick.edge: - Edge - The bottom sides of the blade that could scrape against surfaces.
hockey stick.shaft: - Shaft - The long, main part of the hockey stick, typically made of wood or composite materials.

screw.threads: - Threads - The spiral ridges around the body of the screw that can scrape against materials.
screw.tip: - Tip - The sharp, pointed end of the screw designed to initiate piercing into materials and scrape surfaces.

card.edge: - Edge - The thin, elongated side of the card used for scraping, pushing, or spreading items.
card.corner: - Corner - The pointed angle where two edges meet, useful for more precise scraping tasks.
card.surface: - Surface - The flat, broad side of the card used to spread substances.

coconut shell.bowl: - Bowl - The hollow, concave part of the coconut shell that can hold substances.
coconut shell.interior: - Interior - The smooth inner surface of the coconut shell used for scooping or holding materials.
coconut shell.opening: - Opening - The hole created on the shell to access the inside liquid, allowing it to be poured out.

hat.brim: - Brim - The horizontal extension around the base of the hat that can catch and direct material or liquid.

hard hat.brim: - Brim - The horizontal projection extending around the hard hat's circumference, used to direct liquids and scoop materials.

pliers.jaws: - Jaws - Pincer-like ends of the pliers used for grasping, holding, and applying torque to objects.
pliers.tip: - Tip - The pointed end of the plier jaws, suitable for poking into small areas.
pliers.pivot: - Pivot - The central point around which the handles and jaws move, crucial for the transfer of force when applying torque.

tongs.tips: - Tips - The opposing ends of the tongs used for gripping, mixing, or poking objects.
tongs.prongs: - Prongs - The pointed or narrowed ends of the tongs used for poking or grabbing items.
tongs.arms: - Arms - The elongated parts that transfer movement from the handler to the tips to facilitate mixing.

tweezers.tips: - Tips - Pointed or flat ends of the tweezers used for grasping small objects or precise poking.
tweezers.arms: - Arms - The long parts that converge into the tips, used in pinching to pick up items.

grabber.tongs: - Tongs - The pair of movable arms at the end of the grabber, which close to grasp items.
grabber.grippers: - Grippers - The parts on the inner side of the tongs that make contact with and hold the item securely.
grabber.hooks: - Hooks - Protrusions or indentations on the jaws designed to catch and pull items.
grabber.head: - Head - The part where the jaws are attached, and which can rotate to apply torque.

dart.tip: - Tip - The sharp, pointed end of the dart designed to pierce into surfaces.

skewer.tip: - Tip - The sharp, pointed end of the skewer used to pierce food items or stir mixtures.
skewer.shaft: - Shaft - The long, straight body of the skewer, which can be rotated or moved to mix ingredients.

safety pin.point: - Point - The sharp end of the pin that can puncture or pierce materials.

stilettos.heel: - Heel - The narrow, often pointed part extending from the back of the shoe that can pierce surfaces when pressure is applied.
stilettos.tip: - Tip - The very end of the heel, which is the sharpest point, capable of piercing.

golf tee.tip: - Tip - The very end of the point, specifically designed to penetrate the soil easily.

harpoon.tip: - Tip - The sharp point at the end of the harpoon, designed to pierce through targets.
harpoon.head: - Head - The front section of the harpoon, often broader and pointed or bladed, designed for penetration.
harpoon.barb: - Barb - The pointed part at the tip of the harpoon designed to hook into materials, facilitating pulling.

spear.tip: - Tip - The very end of the spear that first makes contact when piercing.

drill.bit: - Bit - The pointed, rotating end of the drill that bores into materials.
drill.tip: - Tip - The very end of the bit, which is the first part to penetrate the material.

fish hook.point: - Point - The sharp end of the hook that penetrates the fish's mouth.
fish hook.barb: - Barb - A backward-facing projection near the point that secures the fish by catching onto objects.
fish hook.bend: - Bend - The curved section of the hook that leads to the point and can latch onto items.
fish hook.shank: - Shank - The straight section which connects the looped eye to the bend and point.

oil can.spout: - Spout - The narrow, tubular part from which oil is directed out of the can.
oil can.nozzle: - Nozzle - The tapered end of the spout that controls the flow of oil.

watering can.spout: - Spout - The long, protruding part from which water is directed and poured out.
watering can.mouth: - Mouth - The open end of the spout where the water exits.

decanter.mouth: - Mouth - The opening at the top of the decanter where the liquid is poured out.
decanter.neck: - Neck - The narrow part leading up to the mouth that guides the liquid flow.

baton.tip: - Tip - The narrow, multifunctional end of the baton opposite the handle, used for pointing, poking, striking, or mixing ingredients.
baton.shaft: - Shaft - The main cylindrical part of the baton used for impact, stirring, or mixing.

drumstick.tip: - Tip - The pointed end of the drumstick bead, which can be used to poke objects.
drumstick.bead: - Bead - The rounded section at the very end of the tip, specifically shaped for striking but can also be used to poke.

antenna.tip: - Tip - The pointed end of the antenna which can be used to poke.

matchstick.tip: - Tip - The very end of the matchstick that is the head.

coat hanger.ends: - Ends - The very tips of the horizontal bar of the coat hanger, which can be pointy and used for poking.
coat hanger.hook: - Hook - The curved or angled top part of the coat hanger used for hanging it on rods or hooks.

rod.tip: - Tip - The narrow, pointed end of the rod specifically used for poking.
rod.shaft: - Shaft - The long, cylindrical main part of the rod used for mixing in a container.

pipe.end: - End - The tip or opening at either extremity of the pipe, suitable for poking or striking against surfaces.
pipe.body: - Body - The main cylindrical, elongated part of the pipe that facilitates rolling motion and can be used to pound objects.
pipe.surface: - Surface - The cylindrical outer portion that makes contact with the ground during rolling.

stirrer.tip: - Tip - The pointed or slightly tapered end of the stirrer which can be used to poke objects.
stirrer.shaft: - Shaft - The long, straight part of the stirrer that is submerged into liquids to agitate and mix them.

branch.tip: - Tip - The end point of the branch, which is used to poke or prod.
branch.twig: - Twig - A smaller offshoot from the main branch suitable for mixing.

crayon.tip: - Tip - The pointed end of the crayon used for drawing and making marks on surfaces.
crayon.wax: - Wax - The colored substance composing the body of the crayon, which leaves marks on paper.

dowel.tip: - Tip - The narrow, pointed part at either end of the dowel, suitable for poking.
dowel.surface: - Surface - The cylindrical outer part of the dowel that makes contact with other surfaces when rolling.
dowel.body: - Body - The main elongated part of the dowel which rotates along its axis.

dumbbell.end: - End - The rounded, solid part at each side of the dumbbell, which can be used to pound objects.

crowbar.end: - End - The flat, tapered tip of the crowbar used for pounding.
crowbar.claw: - Claw - The curved, forked end of the crowbar used for gripping and pulling nails or prying objects.
crowbar.hook: - Hook - The end opposite the claw, often slightly curved, used to hook onto items for pulling.
crowbar.chisel end: - Chisel End - The flattened, slightly angled end of the crowbar used for inserting into narrow gaps to pry.
crowbar.curve: - Curve - The bent section near one end that increases leverage when prying.

wrench.head: - Head - The solid end of the wrench used for gripping nuts and bolts and transferring applied force, also capable of pounding.
wrench.jaw: - Jaw - The adjustable or fixed opening at the end of the wrench used to grip and turn nuts and bolts.

club.head: - Head - The end of the club typically wider and heavier, used for striking or pounding.

log.end: - End - The flat, cut surface of the log which can be used to pound against something.
log.side: - Side - The cylindrical outer surface of the log which can be rolled and used to exert force.
log.bark: - Bark - The outermost layer of the log that facilitates rolling when in contact with surfaces.

gavel.head: - Head - The solid, typically wooden or metal part at the top of the gavel used for striking.
gavel.face: - Face - The flat end of the head that comes into contact with surfaces to make a sound or indicate authority.

remote control.body: - Body - The main, typically rectangular part of the remote control, which can be used to pound objects.
remote control.back: - Back - The flat rear side of the remote control, which can be used for pounding.

flashlight.body: - Body - The main cylindrical, robust part of the flashlight that can roll on a surface.
flashlight.end: - End - The front end of the flashlight where the light is emitted, often flat or beveled and used for striking.
flashlight.barrel: - Barrel - The long, cylindrical tube that constitutes the main structure of the flashlight, allowing it to roll.

baseball bat.barrel: - Barrel - The thick part of the bat, typically used for hitting the baseball, which can be used to pound objects.
baseball bat.end: - End - The top part of the bat opposite the handle, often capped, which can also be used for pounding.

rolling pin.cylinder: - Cylinder - The long, cylindrical central body of the rolling pin used to make contact with and flatten dough.
rolling pin.body: - Body - The main portion of the rolling pin which is typically made from wood, metal, or plastic and used to exert pressure on dough.

cricket bat.blade: - Blade - The flat hitting surface typically used for striking the cricket ball.
cricket bat.back: - Back - The reverse side of the blade, which can also be used for pounding.

bowling pin.body: - Body - The main cylindrical part of the bowling pin, used for striking with a bowling ball and capable of rolling.

cylinder.surface: - Surface - The curved outer side of the cylinder which contacts the ground to roll.

lipstick.body: - Body - The cylindrical casing of the lipstick, ideal for rolling when placed on its side.
lipstick.tip: - Tip - The exposed part of the lipstick used for application, which can mark or write on surfaces.
lipstick.stick: - Stick - The solid substance inside the casing that is used to apply color to the lips, also capable of writing when pressed against a surface.

marker.body: - Body - The main cylindrical part of the marker that can roll on surfaces.
marker.tip: - Tip - The pointed end of the marker where the ink is released onto the surface.

roller.drum: - Drum - The cylindrical part of the roller that rotates to flatten surfaces.
roller.surface: - Surface - The outer layer of the drum that comes into direct contact with the material being rolled.

battery.side: - Side - The cylindrical lateral surface of the battery, which can roll along a surface.
battery.body: - Body - The main elongated part of the battery that can rotate.

carabiner.gate: - Gate - The movable arm that opens to allow rope or other items to be hooked and securely holds them once closed.
carabiner.spine: - Spine - The solid, curved backbone of the carabiner offering structural support, can be pulled directly.

curtain ring.loop: - Loop - The circular or oval part of the ring through which the curtain rod passes.

grappling hook.hook: - Hook - The curved or angled part that catches onto objects, allowing the grappling hook to pull against them.
grappling hook.flukes: - Flukes - The pointed ends of the hook that dig into or grasp surfaces to provide pulling capacity.

L-bracket.flange: - Flange - One of the flat, perpendicular sections with holes for screws, which could be attached to a surface and used to pull.

wedge.tip: - Tip - The pointed end of the wedge that is inserted first to split or separate objects.
wedge.edge: - Edge - The sharp or tapered sides of the wedge designed for penetrating and forcing materials apart.

straw.shaft: - Shaft - The long, cylindrical part of the straw used to stir or mix contents in a container.

whisk.wires: - Wires - The long, curved metal strands that loop back to the handle, used for stirring and mixing ingredients.
whisk.loop: - Loop - The collective shape formed by the wires at the end opposite to the handle, effective in agitating and blending mixtures.

can opener.blade: - Blade - The sharp part that inserts under the can lid for prying.
can opener.lever: - Lever - The part that pries the lid open after the blade cuts through.

bottle opener.blade: - Blade - The flat, thin part of the bottle opener used to wedge under the bottle cap.
bottle opener.fork: - Fork - The end part of the bottle opener that fits under the cap to lift it off.

colander.holes: - Holes - Small openings distributed throughout the body of the colander used to separate solids from liquids or finer particles from coarser ones.
colander.mesh: - Mesh - A grid-like structure that can be part of the colander serving the same purpose as the holes.

strainer.mesh: - Mesh - The fine, net-like fabric or metal structure with tiny holes designed to separate smaller particles from larger ones.
strainer.bowl: - Bowl - The curved structure that holds the mesh and allows materials to be placed inside for sifting.

basket.base: - Base - The bottom part of the basket where materials can be sifted.
basket.weave: - Weave - The interlaced strands that form the structure of the basket, allowing particles to pass through.
